intro: Guettarda polytheca, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of yellow, pendulous flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its small, elliptical leaves are typically arranged in whorls around the stems. The tree is adaptable to various soil types and thrives in warm, humid climates.
